GapFillInput.Title: Comparative and superlative adjectives
GapFillInput.Instruction: Put the word or phrase in brackets into the comparative or superlative form. Type the answers in each gap.

Content.Question:
1. People are now 10 centimetres taller (tall) than 150 years ago.
2. In the UK the most popular (popular) boys' names are James and John.
3. In Britain in the 14th century sugar was nine times more expensive (expensive) than milk.
4. The racing driver, Michael Schumacher is the highest (high) paid sportsperson in the world.
5. Egyptians made the earliest (early) ship in the world in 2600 BCE.
6. Football is the most popular (popular) sport in the world.
7. Scientists say that green tea is better (good) for you than black tea.
8. More (Many) people go fishing than do any other sport.
9. Tourism is the world's biggest (big) industry with 240 million jobs.
10. Chinese people have the most (many) televisions in the world.
